Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Just a dream, Ma...  Damn dream, is all...

Speaker: tina's mother
Dialogue: Some dream, judging from that.

Speaker: tina's mother
Dialogue: Hold your horses.  You gotta cut your nails or stop that kind of dreaming, Tina.  One or the other.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Oh, shit.

Speaker: rope jumpers
Dialogue: Seven eight, gonna stay up late! Nine ten -- never sleep again!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Worst nightmare I ever had. You wouldn't believe it.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Matter of fact I had a bad dream last night myself...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Had a hardon this morning when I woke up, Tina.  Had your name written all over it.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: There's four letters in my name, Rod.  How could there be room on your joint for four letters?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Hey, up yours with a twirling lawn mower!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Rod says the sweetest things.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He's nuts about you.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Yeah, nuts.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Forget it, the point is, every- body has nightmares once in a while. No biggy.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Next time you have one, just tell yourself that's just all it is, right while you're having it, y'know?  That's the trick. Once you do that, you wake right up.  At least it works for me.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Hey!  You have a nightmare too?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I can't believe his mother let him come over here.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Right.  Well, she didn't, exactly...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: See, I got this cousin who lives near the airport, that it's okay for me to stay with, right?  So I found this sound effects tape at Licorice Pizza, and...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Worked like a charm.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Jesus.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Nice to have a fire.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Really.  Turn 'er up a little.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Maybe we should call Rod, have him come over too.  He might get jealous.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Rod and I are done.  He's too much of a maniac.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: He should join the Marines, they could make something out of him. Like a hand grenade.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: See?  You've forgotten the bad dream.  Didn't I tell you?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: All day long I been seeing that guy's weird face, and hearing those fingernails...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Fingernails?  That's amazing, you saying that. It made me remember the dream I had last night.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What you dream?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I dreamed about this guy in a dirty red and yellow sweater; I dream in color, y'know; he walked into the room I was in, right, right through the wall, like it was smoke or something, and just stared at me.  Sort of ...obscenely.  Then he walked out through the wall on the other side.  Like he'd just come to check me out...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: So what about the fingernails?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He scraped his fingernails along things -- actually, they were more like fingerknives or something, like he'd made them himself?  Anyway, they made this horrible nose --  sssssccrrrtttt....

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Nancy.  You dreamed about the same creep I did, Nancy...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: That's impossible.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Nothing.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: There's somebody out there, isn't there...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I didn't hear anything...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I'm gonna punch out your ugly lights, whoever you are.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: It's just a stupid cat.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Then bring us back its tail and whiskers.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Anyway, I don't have a cat...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Kitty-kitty?  Chow chow chow?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: And it's number thirty-six, Rod Lane, bringing Lantz down just three yards from the goal with a brilliant tackle!  And the fans go wild!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: What the hell you doing here?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Came to make up, no big deal. Your ma home?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Of course.  What's that?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Intense, huh?  So what's happening, an orgy or something?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Maybe a funeral, you dickhead.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: -- Just a sleep-over date, Rod. Just Tina and me.  Glen was just leaving.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You see his face?  Me and Tina got stuff to discuss.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Rod...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: We got her mother's bed. You two got the rest.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: We should get her out of here...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Hey -- you guys're hanging around -- right?  Don't leave me alone with this lunatic -- Pleeeeze, NANCY!

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: So we'll guard her together. Through the night.  In each others' arms like we always said.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen.  Not now.  I mean, we're here for Tina now, not for ourselves.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Why's she so bothered by a stupid nightmare, anyway?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Because he was scary, that's why.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Who was scary?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Don't you think it's weird, her and me dreaming about the same guy?  You didn't have a bad dream last night, did you?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Me?  I don't dream.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Morality sucks.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: I knew there was sometihng about you I liked...

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You feel better now, right?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Jungle man fix Jane.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: No more fights?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: No more fights.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Good.  No more nightmares for either of us then.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: When did you have a nightmare?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Guys can have nightmares too, y'know.  You ain't got a corner on the fucking market or something.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Where'd you get this snotty old thing?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: ROD...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Who the fuck you think you are, whoever you are?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Somebody there?

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Tina.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Who the hell is that?

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Oh, shit, please God...

Speaker: killer
Dialogue: This is God...

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Nancy!  Open the door -- Nancy!

Speaker: man
Dialogue: She's still awake.  Nancy can't hear you.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: T-tina!?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: What the hell's going ON here! Tina!

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Tina --

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You motherfucker!  I'll kill you for that!

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: What the hell's going on!?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Oh -- jeez -- Glen!  Rod's gone ape!

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Rod?  Rod, you better not hurt Tina...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yeah.  Something slippering all over here...  Tina?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Oh, shit...

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Lieutenant Thompson.  Sorry to wake you, but --

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I'd've canned your ass if you hadn't.  What you got?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Her name was Tina Gray.  It was her home.  Father abandoned ten years ago, mother's in Vegas with a boyfriend.  We're trying to reach her now.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: What's the Coroner got to say?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Something like a razor was the weapon, but nothing found on the scene.

Speaker: sergeant garcia
Dialogue: Leautenant.  You know who --

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: sergeant garcia
Dialogue: I put her in your office...

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Looks like her boyfriend did it.  Rod Lane.  Musician type, arrests for brawling, dope --

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Terrific.  What the hell was she doing there?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: She lived there.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Hello to you, too, Donald.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Marge.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Okay.  Hi, dad.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I don't want to get into this now, god knows you need time.  But I'd sure would like to know what the hell you were doing shacked up with three other kids in the middle of the night -- especially a delinquent lunatic like Lane.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Rod's not a lunatic.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: You got a sane explanation for what he did?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Apparantly he was crazy jealous. Nancy said they'd had a fight, Rod and Tina.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It wasn't that serious...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Maybe you don't think murder's serious --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: She was my best friend!  Don't you dare say I don't take her death seriously!  I just meant their fights weren't that serious.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: She had a nightmare about somebody trying to kill her, last night. That's why we were there; she was afraid to sleep alone.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: She's been through enough for one night.  You have her statement.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I suggest you keep a little better track on her -- she's still a kid, y'know.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You think I knew there were boys there!?  You try raising a teenager alone.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: See they get home okay.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Where you think you're going?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: School.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I could hear you tossing and turning all night, kiddo.  You've no business going to school.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I gotta go to school, Mom. Please.  Otherwise I'll just sit up there and go crazy or something.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Did you sleep?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I'll sleep in study hall, promise. I'd rather keep busy, you know?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Right home after.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I'm not gonna hurt you.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Your old man thinks I did it, don't he?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He doesn't know you.  Couldn't you change?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: The cops were all over my house.  They'll kill me for sure.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Nobody's gonna kill you.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I never touched her.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You were screaming like crazy.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Someone else was there.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: The door was locked from your side.

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Don't look at me like I'm some kind of fucking fruitcake or something, I'm warning you.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Now just step away from her, son. Like your ass depended on it. I'm warning you.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: thompson
Dialogue: Jesus -- are you crazy!?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You used me, daddy!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: What the hell you doing going to school today, anyway -- your mother told me you didn't even sleep last night!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Nancy!  Hey!

Speaker: teacher
Dialogue: According to Shakespeare, there was something operating in Nature, perhaps inside human nature itself, that was rotten -- a canker, as he put it.

Speaker: surfer
Dialogue: Uh, In the most high and palmy state of Rome...

Speaker: english teacher
Dialogue: Can it.

Speaker: surfer
Dialogue: O God, I could be bounded in a nutshell and count myself a king of infinite space, were it not that I have bad dreams...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Tina!

Speaker: hallguard
Dialogue: Y-you're not supposed to run. W-where's your pass -- you got a pass?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Screw your stupid pass!

Speaker: hallguard
Dialogue: Hey, no running in the halls!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Tina?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Who are you?

Speaker: man
Dialogue: Gonna get you.

Speaker: teacher
Dialogue: Okay -- Okay, Thompson!  Every- thing's all right now -- Nancy!.

Speaker: teacher
Dialogue: I'll call your mother.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No!  No, really, I'm fine.  I'll go straight home.  I'm okay.

Speaker: teacher
Dialogue: You'll need a hall pass!

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Couldn't get back to sleep at all.  What you dream?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: My dad here?

Speaker: sergeant garcia
Dialogue: Lieutenant.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Decide to take a day off after all?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Dad, I want to see Rod Lane.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Only family allowed, Nancy.  You know the drill.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Just want to talk to him a second.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: He's dangerous.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You don't know he did it.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: No, I know, thanks to your own testimony, that he was locked in a room with a girl who went in alive and came out in a rubber bag.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I just want to talk to him.  Please, Dad.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Make it fast.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: And then what happened?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I told you.  It was dark, but I'm sure there was someone else IN there, under the covers with her.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: How could somebody get under the covers with you guys without you knowing it?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: How the fuck do I know?  I don't expect you to believe me.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What he look like?  You get a look at him?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Well then how can you say somebody else was there?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: Because somebody cut her.  While I watched.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Somebody cut her while you watched and you don't know what he looked like?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: You couldn't see the fucker. You could just see the cuts happening, all at once.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What you mean 'all at once'?

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I mean, it was as if there were four razors cutting her at the same time.  But invisible razors. She just... opened up...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Rod!

Speaker: rod
Dialogue: I probably could've saved her if I'd moved sooner...  But I thought it was just another nightmare, like the one I had the night before.  There... was this guy who had knives for fingers...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Nancy, don't fall asleep in there.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Get into bed.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I will.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Mother, for petesakes.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Warm milk.  Gross.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Nancy!  NANCY!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Mommy!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I told you!  Hundreds of people a year drown like that!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Great

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: To bed with you, c'mon.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: No television, forget the homework, no phone calls.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No, Mother.  Yes, Mother. No, Mother.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: And no school tomorrow, either. you take a little vacation, relax and rest for a change.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yes, Mother.  G'night.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Take this, it'll help you sleep.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Sleep tight, don't let the bedbugs bite.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Sorry!  Saw your light on. Thought I'd see how you were.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Sometimes I wish you didn't live right across the street.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Shut up and let me in.  You ever stand on a rose trellis in your bare feet?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: If you don't mind.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: So.  I heard you freaked out in English class today.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Guess I did.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Haven't slept, have you?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Not really.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You look dead and rained on, if you want the ugly truth.  And what you do to your arm?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Burned myself in Englsh class.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: M'god, I look twenty years old.  You have any weird dreams last night?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Slept like a rock.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You believe it's possible to dream about what's going to happen?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You believe in the Boogey Man?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: One two, Freddie's coming for you?  No.  Rod killed Tina. he's a fruitcake and you know it.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You believe in anything?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I believe in you, me, and Rock and Roll.  And I'm not too sure about you lately.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Listen, I got a crazy favor to ask.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Uh-oh...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It's nothing too hard or anything.  I'm just going to... LOOK for someone, and... I want you to be sort of a ...guard. Okay?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Okay?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Okay, okay.  I think.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You won't screw up, right?  I mean, a whole lot might depend on it.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Okay, I won't screw up.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Shhh.  Now listen, here's what we're gonna do...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You still there?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Yeah.  So?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Just checking -- keep out of sight!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: On your toes, right?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen!!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I swear...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen, where are you!  Wake up! Glen!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen!  Glen!!!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glennn!!!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen, you bastard...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: But you.  You shit -- what do you do -- you fall asleep!

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Oh, shit.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yes, mother?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You okay?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yeah.  Just had a little dream. I'm falling right back to sleep.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Okay... You need anything, just call.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You mind telling me what's going on?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Garcia, I want to see Rod Lane again.

Speaker: sgt garcia
Dialogue: I thought when I took the night shift I'd have peace and quiet for a change.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It's urgent, we've gotta see Rod.

Speaker: sgt garcia
Dialogue: It's three in the morning. Your mother know you're out this late?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Of course -- look, at least go back and look at him.  Just see if he's okay.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: We have reason to think there might be something weird going on.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Dad -- what you doing here?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: It so happens I work here, and there's an unsolved murder.  I don't like unsolved murders, especially ones my daughter's mixed up in -- what are you doing here at this hour?  You're supposed to be getting some sleep.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Listen, sir, this is serious. Nancy had a nightmare about Rod being in danger, or something, and so she thinks...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I just want to see if he's okay!

Speaker: sgt garcia
Dialogue: Take my word for it, Nancy.  The guy's sleeping like a baby.  He's not going anywhere.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: This isn't your average nightmare, Daddy -- damn it!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Now look, Nancy, don't push it.  You've already rubbed my nose in sex, drugs and violence -- don't start throwing in insanity!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Just go back and check -- please!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Okay, Garcia.  What the hell.

Speaker: sgt garcia
Dialogue: Right...  Now where'd I put the key...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Rod!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Gimme a hand, dammit!

Speaker: sgt garcia
Dialogue: Goddamn loco kid -- he didn't have t'do that -- Madre dios!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: How'd you know he was gonna do this?

Speaker: minister
Dialogue: Ashes to ashes, dust to dust. May God be with this young man's soul.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Amen to that much.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: How's Nancy doing?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I don't think she's slept since Tina died.  She's always been a delicate kid.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: She's tougher than you think. Any idea how she knew Rod was gonna kill himself?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: No.  All I know is, this reminds me too much of ten years ago.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Yeah.  Well... Let's not start digging up bodies just because we're in a cemetery.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Time to go home, baby.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: The killer's still loose, you know.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: You saying somebody else killed Tina?  Who?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I don't know who he is.  But he's burned, he wears a weird hat, a red and yellow sweater, real dirty, and he uses some sort of knifes he's got made into a sort of... glove.  Like giant finger- nails.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I think you should keep Nancy at home a few days.  'Til she's really over the shock.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I got something better...  I'm gonna get you help, baby. So no one will threaten you any more.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: But I just don't feel... ready to sleep yet.  Please, do I have to?

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Don't worry, you're not gonna change into Bride of Frankenstein or anything.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: No, nothing.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He means, did you ever drop me on my head.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Nightmares are expected after psychological trauma.  Don't worry, they go away.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I sure as hell hope so.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Everyone's got to dream. If you don't dream, you go...  All set?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: They're just simple tests, Nan.  We'll both be right here.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Look, I know it's been fright- ening, I know your dreams have seemed real.  But... it's okay.  Okay?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Please, Nancy.  Trust us.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It's not you I don't trust. It's...  Okay.  Let's do it.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: How long's this been going on?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Since the murder.  She was fine before that.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Not to worry.  No signs of path- ology in Nancy's EEG or pulse rate.  I'd guess what we've got is a normal young girl who just happens to have gone through two days of hell.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: It's just made her think... her dreams are real...

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Ever hear the old Buddhist tale about the King who dreamed he was a beggar who dreamed he was a king?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Thank God.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: What the hell are dreams, anyway?

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Mysteries.  Incredible body hookus pokus.  Truth is we still don't know what they are or where they come from. As for nightmares...  Did you know that in the last three years twenty Philipino refugees in California died in the middle of nightmares? Not from heart attacks, either. They just died.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: What happened?  That needle sank like a rock.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Right now she's like a diver on the bottom of an ocean no one's mapped yet.  Waiting to see what shows up.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Okay, she's started to dream.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: How can you tell?

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: R.E.M.'s.  Rapid eye movements. The eyes follow the dream -- their movement picks up on this --

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: What the hell's this?  She awake or asleep?

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Can't be.  It never gets this high...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: NANCY!!!  IT'S MOM -- NANCY!!!!

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Now, this is just going to let you relax and sleep, Nan --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No.  That's enough sleep.

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Okay, kid.  Okay.  Fair enough.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Oh my god, oh my god...

Speaker: dr king
Dialogue: Get the kit!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You believe this?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Where the hell did you get that?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I grabbed it off his head.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: She said she snatched it off his head in a dream.  Gotta go.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Go even crazier?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I don't think you're going crazy -- and stop drinking that damn coffee!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Did you ask Daddy to have the hat examined?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I threw that filthy thing away -- I don't know what you're trying to prove with it, but --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What I learned at the dream clinic, that's what I'm trying to prove.  Rod didn't kill Tina, and he didn't hang himself. It's this guy -- he's after us in our dreams.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: But that's just not reality, Nancy!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It's real, Mamma.  Feel it.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Put that damned thing down!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: His name is even in it -- written right in here -- Fred Krueger -- Fred Krueger!  You know who that is, Mamma?  You better tell me, cause now he's after me!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Nancy, trust your mother for once -- you'll feel better as soon as you sleep!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You call this feeling better? Or should I grab a bottle and veg out with you -- avoid everything happening to me by just getting good and loaded --

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Fred Krueger can't be after you, Nancy -- he's dead!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You knew about him all this time, and you've been acting like he was someone I made up!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You're sick, Nancy.  Imagining things.  You need to sleep, it's as simple as that.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Screw sleep!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: That's enough!

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Whenever I get nervous I eat.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: And if you can't do that, you sleep.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Used to.  Not anymore.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: They got a whole system they call 'dream skills'.  So, if you have a nightmare, for instance like falling, right?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yeah.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Instead of screaming and getting nuts, you say, okay, I'm gonna make up my mind that I fall into a magic world where I can get something special, like a poem or song.  They get all their art literature from dreams.  Just wake up and write it down.  Dreamskills.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: And what if they meet a monster in their dream?  Then what?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: They turn their back on it.  Takes away its energy, and it disappears.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What happens if they don't do that?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I guess those people don't wake up to tell what happens.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Great.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: 'Booby Traps and Improvised Anti-personel Devices'!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I found it at this neat survivalist bookstore on Ventura.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Well what you reading it for?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I'm into survival.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: She's starting to scare the living shit out of me.

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: And the other...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Where's your mask and gun?

Speaker: foreman
Dialogue: Don't bust my chops, lady. If the city found out I put 'em in without inside releases I'd loose my license.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Oh gross...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Oh, Mom...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: 'S'mine...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What's with the bars?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: S'curity.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Mom, I want to know what you know about Fred Krueger.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Dead and gone.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I want to know how, where -- if you don't tell me, I'm going to call daddy.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I do want to know.  He's not dead and gone -- he's after me and if I sleep he'll get me! I've got to know!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: All right.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: You want to know who Fred Krueger was?  He was a filthy child killer who got at least twenty kids, kids from our area, kids we all knew.  It drove us all crazy when we didn't know who was doing it -- but it was even worse when they caught him.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: So he's alive?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: He wouldn've stopped.  The bastard would've got more kids first chance he got -- they found nearly ten bodies in his boiler room as it was.  But the law couldn't touch him.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: What did you do, mother?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Bunch of us parents tracked him down after they let him go.  Found him in an old boiler room, just like before.  Saw him lying there in that caked red and yellow sweater he always wore, drunk an' asleep with his weird knives by his side...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Go on...

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: We poured gasoline all around the place, left a trail out the door, locked the door, then...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Who was there?  Were Tina's parents there?  Were Rod's?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Sure, and Glen's.  All of us. But that's in the past now, baby.  Really.  It's over.  We even took his knives.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: All these years you've kept those things buried down here?  In our own house?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Hello?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Oh.  Hi, how y'doing?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I heard your ma went ape at the security store today.  You look like the Prisoner of Zenda or something.  How long's it been since you slept?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Coming up on the seventh day.  It's okay, I checked Guiness.  The record's eleven, and I'll beat that if I have to.  Listen, I... I know who he is.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Who?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: The killer.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You do?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Yeah, and if he gets me, I'm pretty sure you're next.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Me!?  Why would anyone want to kill me?!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Don't ask -- just give me some help nailing this guy when I bring him out.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Bring him out of what?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: My dream.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: How you plan to do that?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Just like I did the hat.  Have a hold of the sucker when you wake me up.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Me?  Wait a minute, you can't bring someone out of a dream!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: If I can't, then you all can relax, because it'll just be a simple case of me being nuts.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I can save you the trouble. You're nutty as a fruitcake. I love you anyway.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Good, then you won't mind cold-cocking this guy when I bring him out.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: What!?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You heard me.  I grab him in the dream -- you see me struggling so you wake me up.  We both come out, you cold cock the fucker, and we got him.  Clever, huh?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You crazy?  Hit him with what?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You're a jock.  You must have a baseball bat or something. Come to my window at midnight. And meanwhile...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Meanwhile..?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Meanwhile whatever you do don't fall asleep.  Midnight.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Holy shit!  Midnight.  Baseball bats and boogemen.  Unfucking real.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Can't sleep, thought I'd come break up the poker game.

Speaker: sergeant garcia
Dialogue: If it was any more quiet we could hear owls farting.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Is quiet, isn't it?

Speaker: sergeant garcia
Dialogue: How's your girl?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: She's sensible.  She'll sleep sooner or later.

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: You'd think they'd have some- thing 'bout the Lane kid hanging himself.

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Maybe we're all making more out of it than we should.

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Glen?  you all right?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Whuu?

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: How can you listen to Carson and a record at the same time?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Wasn't listening to the tube, just watching.  Miss Nude America's supposed to be on tonight.

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Well how you gonna hear what she says?

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Who cares what she says?

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: You should get to sleep soon, Glen.  It's almost midnight. Goodness knows we've all had enough of a time the last few days...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: I will, Mom...in a while. You guys turning in?

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Pretty soon.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: We'll go away, take a vacation. Get your hair colored nice, the way it was.  No one will ever know.  This whole room smells of coffee, y'know?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Okay.

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Shouldn't stare.

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Know what I think?  I think that kid's some kinda lunatic.

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Shouldn't say such a thing about the poor child.  If you mean the bars, Marge's just being cautious, her being alone and Nancy acting so nervous lately.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Hang on GLEN...

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: Well, I'm not gonna risk sneaking out until she does.

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Who at this hour?

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: Hello?  It's her.  She wants to talk to Glen.

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: About what?

Speaker: mrs lantz
Dialogue: What's this about, Nancy?

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Glen's asleep.  Talk to him tomorrow!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen.  Don't fall asleep...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Glen?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Brilliant.  Now what if Glen calls?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I'm awake, I am awake.  This is not a dream!  I am --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Give me the key, mother.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I don't even have it on me, so forget it.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: GLEEENNNNNN!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Okay, Krueger, you bastard. We play in your court.

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Lieutenant.  It's your daughter. Says it's urgent.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Tell her I'm not here, tell her...

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Uh, she just saw you, sir...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Hi daddy.  I know what happened.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Then you know more than I do -- I haven't even been upstairs.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: You know he's dead though, right?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Yeah, apparantly he's dead. How the hell'd you know?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I've got a proposition for you.  Listen very carefully, please.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Nan, I --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Please.  I'm gonna go get the guy who did it and bring him to you.  I just need you be right there to arrest him. Okay?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Just tell me who did it and I'll go get him, baby.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Fred Krueger did it, Daddy, and only I can get him.  It's my nightmare he comes to.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Where'd you hear about Krueger --

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: -- I want you to come over here and break the door down exactly twenty minutes from now -- can you do that?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Sure, but...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: That'll be exactly half past midnight.  Time for me to fall asleep and find him.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Sure, sure, honey.  You just do that -- get yourself some sleep -- that's what I've been saying all along.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: And you'll be here to catch him, right?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Lieutenant -- they're waiting upstairs.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Sure, okay, I'll be there. Now you just turn in and get some rest, sweetheart.  Please. Deal?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Deal.

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: 'Anything funny' like what?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I don't know -- but one thing for sure, I don't want her coming over here.  She's way too far gone to be able to to handle this.

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: What the hell did that, Lieutenant?  There ain't even a head left.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Goddamed if I know.  What's the Coronor say?

Speaker: cop
Dialogue: He's in the john puking since he saw it.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Guess I should'n'a done it.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Just sleep now, Mom.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Just wanted to protect you, Nan.  Just wanted to protect you...

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: I know it's hard to think at a time like this, Walter, but can you think of anyone who could've done such a thing?

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: He done it.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Who?  Who did that?

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Krueger.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Krueger?

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Had to've done it.  No one else was in there.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: How you know that?

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Cause I thought Glen was gonna sneak out to see your lunatic daughter, that's why. So I locked him in his room!  Sorry.  Anyways, the door was still locked when we heard the screams.

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Keep your head -- this is a fucking flesh and blood killer we're talking about.

Speaker: mr lantz
Dialogue: Like Rod Lane?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Come out and show yourself, you bastard.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I'm crazy after all...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Help!  Hey -- Daddy -- I got him trapped!  Where are you!?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Everything's going to be all right!  Everything's under control!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Get my father, you asshole!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Nancy -- for god's sake's run!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Daddy!  Where are you!

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Poor woman's got her hands full with that kid.  Maybe I better tell the lieutenant.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Hey fuckface -- can't catch me!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Come on -- he's in here! Daddy!  Don't let him kill me too!

Speaker: krueger
Dialogue: Ready for these?

Speaker: coroner
Dialogue: Found you something, Donald. Should remind you of something...

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: Hey -- your daughter's acting kinda -- !  Strange...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: DAD!  GET US OUTTA HERE!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus -- Nancy!  Hey!  We got a fire!

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about, Nancy?

Speaker: lt thompson
Dialogue: NANCY!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: He's under there!  Watch it!

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Now do you believe me?

Speaker: parker
Dialogue: You find him?  Sir?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I know you're there, Krueger.

Speaker: freddie
Dialogue: You think you was gonna get away from me?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I know you too well now, Freddie.

Speaker: freddy
Dialogue: And now you die...

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: It's too late, Krueger.  I know the secret now -- this is just a dream, too -- you're not alive -- the whole thing is a dream -- so fuck off! I want my mother and friends again.

Speaker: freddie
Dialogue: You what?

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: I take back every bit of energy I ever gave you. You're nothing.  You're shit.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: God, it's bright.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: Gonna burn off soon or it wouldn't be so bright.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Feeling better?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: They say you've bottomed out when you can't remember the night before.  No more drinking, Baby, suddenly I just don't feel like it any more.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: Nah.  Just slept heavy.

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: See ya.

Speaker: nancy
Dialogue: See ya.

Speaker: glen
Dialogue: You believe this fog?

Speaker: marge
Dialogue: I believe anything's possible.

Speaker: tina
Dialogue: Lookin' good, girl!

Speaker: girls
Dialogue: One two -- Freddy's coming for you! Three four -- Better lock your door! Five six -- Get your Crucifix Seven eight -- Gonna stay up late! Nine ten -- Never sleep again!
